name: Silken Al-Andalus Palace Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this hotel gets the thumbs up from me. Stayed for 3 nights 17th March 2007 on a bed only basis. Lovely place to stay.
reviews.title: Excellant Hotel
excellent hotel
reviews.text: We have stayed at the silken twice and found it to be excellent both times. The rooms are really spacious and nicely decorated, very large bathrooms with walk in showers. We were lucky enough to have a room with a large balcony overlooking the pool on one occasion, at no extra cost. The pool area is wonderful, it's a real oasis and you really wouldn't know that you are only a short way out of the city. There is taxi rank outside the hotel and a bus stop round the corner with regular buses into the centre, you can walk but it was rather hot when we were there! 38c when we were going out at 9pm!! The breakfast at the hotel was also excellent, so much to choose from, something to suit all tastes and diets. I would definately stay here again, hopefully sooner rather than later. Also in my mind Seville beats Madrid and Barcelona hands down if you are looking for a real spanish city experience.

The hotel is a large convention-style business hotel next to the soccer stadium, a five-to-ten-minute cab ride south of the center of Seville. It is probably a great place to stay in the summer because there is a good-sized swimming pool in a garden behind the hotel, and it is a quiet area.
reviews.title: Stayed at New Years in Seville

likes.liked: — large triple room; fairly priced restaurants in hotel
likes.disliked: — far from center; no nearby shops/dining

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the winter, of course, the pool is shut and the away-from-it location was a drag. There is a city bus, the number 34, that you can take into Seville center, but it takes twenty minutes and lets you off a block or two from the cathedral with no other downtown stops. We had to use taxis most of the time, as there are no restaurants or shops near the hotel -- although there are four restaurants IN the hotel (cafe, buffet, Italian, and fine dining) and they are fairly priced.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our triple room (3222) was very long with an area at the end for the third bed and a small sofa. We appreciated that there were three real beds and that the window faced towards the garden. The adjacent rooms 3221 and others down the hall would have also had good-sized balconies overlooking the garden, which would have been nice as the weather was terrific. Although it was a non-smoking room, the ventillation system is such that you get some smoke-smell from other rooms. There is wireless at the hotel but the hotel is so large that it didn't reach our room; we used a lounge area near the elevators when we wanted wireless.
reviews.title: Good, but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Seville for 3 nites in late April 07. I was a little anxious due to the mixed reviews the Andalus received..
reviews.title: Not quite 4 star, but not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, the hotel does lack some character, it seems to be more business orientated and not very personable. But it is modern, clean, rooms were large, and the pool area is lovely, for a city hotel. Try and get a room with a balcony overlooking the pool...rooms 3210 to 3220.
reviews.title: Average hotel. Decent pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff weren't particularly friendly, but that might be just a Spanish thing! The buffet breakfast was superb with loads of choice and of course freshly squezzed Seville oranges! We only ate once in the hotel and it was just OK, but you're not going to dine in your hotel when in Seville. There is an amazing array of Tapas bars and restaurants downtown.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and spacious but lacks character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is about 2 miles from the centre, but we used the 34 bus around the corner a lot, and found it very efficient and frequent, we never waited any longer than 10 minutes for it. The taxi from town was only about €5/€6 .
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all i would recommend the Andalus as an ideal base for a few days in Seville, as it is good value and convenient.
reviews.title: What a Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a large modern one, used by tourists, business travellers and conferences. It is towards the outer edges of Seville, which means you can get a car to it (unlike anything in the centre) and has its own car park. We used it as a base to explore the area around Seville, for which it did an excellent job at a very good price. I would not use it to explore the centre attractions - go closer if you want that.
reviews.title: Good for exploring the area

reviews.text: The hotel itself is modern and typical business type, so do not expect a character hotel, but is well appointed and efficient. There are few restaurants close by, but that does not matter because there is an excellent bus service into the centre which gives access to the wealth of restaurants and bars located there. It is in the university area, so the restaurants that are close are fine.
reviews.title: Really good hotel!

likes.disliked: — There was no coffee at 4pm on Sunday: the machine in the cafe was broken, and all other bars were closed until 6pm.

reviews.text: It is a really good hotel for a reasonable price. It is not very cheap, we paid £340 for five days for a family of three incl. breakfast, but it is a great value for what you get, to my opinion. A spacious clean room. Plenty of toiletries. Effective air conditioning, but you can also open the window if you wish. A nice garden. Fantastic buffet breakfast (in two restaurants; in a small Palace restaurant it is better). Also, there are several restaurants where you can get excellent meals, and the room service, which was helpful when we arrived in the evening with a tired child. Again, prices are not very cheap but not excessive.
reviews.title: A very glam hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is located not in the center, which is very convenient if you come with a car; there is a safe underground car park for extra 9 euros/day. No problem to get to or from the city center by bus or taxi (5-7 euros). On the way back, it took only fifteen minutes to get to the airport in a hired car.
reviews.title: Pleasent hotel, Highly rated

reviews.text: Several things to be aware of, however. Search different websites for a better bargain; the hotel website is not so good. The outdoor swimming pool is closed from 15th September, probably because it is too cold (only 30C when we stayed in the end of October!) A so-called gym club is a laugh, a tiny room with four machines. There are no play facilities for children, which is a shame. British tourists, be aware: there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel even though the location is a bit far from the city centre

likes.liked: — Price, ease of accomodating teenager in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for four nights in October, booking through Expedia, paying £45 a night for a double room without breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, amenities outweigh location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the size of the hotel the staff were all friendly and extremely helpful. Check-in was quick and the porter parked our car for us in the hotel carpark [although I felt the 9€ charge per night was a little steep] Our room was clean and had a good view of the foot-ball stadium. Very quiet with regard to traffic noise, but don't bank on an early night if there is a football match on.
reviews.title: SILKEN AL-ANDALUS PALACE - Great Value

reviews.text: Carpets in the corridors looked a bit the worse for wear, but I'm probably being a bit fussy. As has been mentioned before, the hotel has a very modern design, and some of the public areas had more style than character. Pool area was excellent, and even in October the water was warm enough for swimming. In the peak season I would guess that there might be a lack of sun-beds.
reviews.title: Wait a while!!!

likes.liked: — Overall extremely good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Personally we preferred the out of city location - no problem with car-parking and very quiet. The bus service was excellent if we didn't want to walk, and taxis were plentiful.
reviews.title: Friendly Four Star

likes.liked: — Freindly relaxed staff and great room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel did a special breakfast deal at €6.95 [I think] which was cheaper than the Expedia B&B rate. We took this option once, but the rest of the time preferred to eat at the cafe 3 minutes walk away on the main road into the city. We had one meal in the coffee shop as we were too tired to go back into Seville. Good value for money. On our last night the heavens opened, so we ate in the Italian restaurant. Good food and surprisingly cheap BUT due to the weather more and more people wanted to eat in, with the result that the staff became overwhelmed and ended up turning customers away.
reviews.title: Great Retreat In A Wonderful City

likes.liked: — Situated away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre.

description: Silken Al-Andalus Palace Hotel is a modern, well-lit establishment with 623 rooms and renewed in 2006. It has good access from the centre of Seville, located among the gardens of Heliopolis district and near Maria Luis Park and its main square (Plaza de España). This Sevillian hotel makes it good for the guest to walk around its more than 15,000 m² garden surface, take a relaxing bath in its unique swimming-pool, rest in its spacious rooms with free connection to the Internet or taste a glass of wine in its snack bar.It is the only hotel in Spain that has a whole floor furnished and decorated by prestigious Victorio & Lucchino: 9 luxurious, exclusive suites to enjoy oneself, works of art, oriental furniture, plasma screen TVs, wood and glass baths, sound equipment and private check-in service which help create a deluxe, sophisticated atmosphere. This is a hotel which radiates light, is visitor sensitive, and offers all types of comforts, sophistication and exclusivity. It only takes 10 minutes to get to the hotel from the historical centre of Seville and there is easy access from the AVE (High Speed Train) station and the airport.
